Rulings.Edison:
● The ① effect is a Continuous Effect.

About the ② effect:
● It is a mandatory Trigger Effect.
● it will activate (in the GY/Banishment) even if this card is destroyed by battle, due to TCG ruling differences (e.g. vs "Skill Drain").
● In Edison format, if two 0 ATK monsters battle, they will be destroyed.
● If the ATK of "Tragoedia" is set to 0 by this effect, it will remain 0 even if the number of cards in hand changes.
● If the activation of this effect is negated (e.g. by "Light and Darkness Dragon"), it will not activate again during that End Step.

About the ③ effect:
● It is a mandatory Trigger Effect.
● It will not activate if this card is not in face-up Defense Position.
● If the activation of this effect is negated (e.g. by "Light and Darkness Dragon"), it will continue to activate until it can resolve.
Rulings.Tengu: ●This effect activates even if “Reptilianne Naga” is destroyed during the Damage Step. If “Reptilianne Naga” is in face-up Attack Position, the effect to change it to Attack Position does not activate. The effect to change a monster’s ATK to 0 applies as long as that monster is face-up on the field.

Rulings.Base:
1. This effect activates even if "Reptilianne Naga" is destroyed during the Damage Step.

(For ruling #1, Naga’s effect to change a monster’s ATK to 0 activates in the End Step, so it must be face-up at that time. Source: j-wiki.)
2. If "Reptilianne Naga" is in face-up Attack Position, the effect to change it to Attack Position does not activate.
3. The effect to change a monster's ATK to 0 applies as long as that monster is face-up on the field.

PSCT.Edison:
① This card cannot be destroyed by battle.
② At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card battled: the ATK of the monster(s) this card battled becomes 0.
③ During your End Phase, if you control this Attack Position card: change this card to face-up Defense Position.

PSCT.Base: This card cannot be destroyed by battle. The ATK of any monster that battles this card becomes 0 at the end of that Battle Phase. During your End Phase, change this face-up Defense Position card on the field to face-up Attack Position.
